results.title: The Infinite voyage
results.creator_credit: Chip Walter, National Academy of Sciences and WQED
results.brief_description: Focusing on current and compelling scientific topics, this series is a unique visual presentation that inspires students to see their world in new ways and discover how modern technologies contribute to scientific discovery. These programs go beyond the latest technology reports in newspapers, magazines, and television to the personal stories of people at the boundaries of scientific research. A journey to the very brink of scientific exploration where individuals and technology meet the unknown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chip Walter, National Academy of Sciences and WQED

results.title: The Trumpet
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films and Record Group and National Committee for Audio-Visual Aids in Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Philip Jones talks of the history of the trumpet and examines its development. Comparisons are made with the cornet and the bugle, and we see such early instruments as the slide trumpet and the trumpet with crooks. Several famous works for the trumpet are played.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anvil Films and Record Group and National Committee for Audio-Visual Aids in Education

results.title: Robin Klein
results.creator_credit: David Haythornthwaite, Janet Bell and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Storymakers”.
In this video, Robin Klein one of Australia’s most prolific and popular authors, discusses the process of writing a book and the ways she collects ideas. Scenes form “Penny Pollard’s Diary” are interspersed with Robin describing her craft as a writer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Haythornthwaite, Janet Bell and Film Australia

results.title: The Illustrators (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Martin Daley, Janet Bell and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Storymakers”.
We all know that illustrators make pictures, but are they also story makers? Indeed they are! This program shows how illustrators add to the written word, how pictures tell a story, and the process of making picture books. Features Julie Vivas, Roland Harvey and Jeannie Baker.

results.title: Colin Thiele
results.creator_credit: Aviva Ziegler, Paul Humfress and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Storymakers”.
Storymakers is a series which highlights different aspects of the process of creating a book and is designed to develop children’s awareness of how books are conceived and created, and to encourage a love of books and reading. In this video, school student, Jonathen Appleton, visits author Colin Thiele to discuss the craft of writing. This program features some scenes from his novels including the classic “Storm Boy”, “The Sun on the Stubble” and the newly published “Jodie’s Journey”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Aviva Ziegler, Paul Humfress and Film Australia
results.description:

results.title: The Piano. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
A study of the expanding technique of pianoforte composition and playing during the 18th and 19th centuries, contrasting the delicacies of a Chopin Nocturne with the enormous complexities of Liszt, Schubert, Schumann, Brahms; many of the other great romantics are discussed and the modern school is touched on.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and World Mirror-Realist Films

results.title: The Organ. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Simon Preston, speaking from the console of the great Harrison organ in Westminster Abbey, tells of the history and construction of the instrument. He explains the simple theory of sound generation, the problems of providing constant air pressure, and the complexities of playing. Works by Mozart, Purcell and others are played.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.description:

results.title: Orchestral percussion
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
James Blades accompanied by Joan Goossens explains the history of instruments of percussion and tells the story of their development from the striking of a hollow log or empty gourd to the percussion instruments of the modern orchestra.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and World Mirror-Realist Films

results.title: The Orchestra
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
The formation, selection and training of the National Youth Orchestra of Great Britain. Spotlights each section of the orchestra as they rehearse subtleties of intonation and phrasing until something like perfection is achieved. Then they perform Dvorak’s Carnival Overture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.description:

results.title: Melodic percussion
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Anvil Films and Record Group and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
James Blades demonstrates the orchestral instruments of percussion - other than timpani - which are capable of melody as opposed to pure rhythm. the xylophone, vibraphone, marimba, glockenspiel, tubular bells and tuned gongs emerge in detail as vital parts of the modern orchestra and dance band.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Anvil Films and Record Group and World Mirror-Realist Films

Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
James Blades demonstrates the orchestral instruments of percussion - other than timpani - which are capable of melody as opposed to pure rhythm. the xylophone, vibraphone, marimba, glockenspiel, tubular bells and tuned gongs emerge in detail as vital parts of the modern orchestra and dance band.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
James Blades demonstrates the orchestral instruments of percussion - other than timpani - which are capable of melody as opposed to pure rhythm. the xylophone, vibraphone, marimba, glockenspiel, tubular bells and tuned gongs emerge in detail as vital parts of the modern orchestra and dance band.
